Description: Fragment of seal impression in clay; partial impression of a scarab-seal; motif impressed on top quite eroded, representing a walking lion with sun disk above back and unidentified element in front of it; back with numerous rope/string impressions.
Curator's comments: The motif of the impression reproduced one of the commonest themes on Naukratis scarabs, the walking lion. Petrie illustrates a number of different versions (Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVII, 34-45). This type was widely distributed in the Mediterranean area (Gorton 1996, 93, 95-96, type XXVIII A, see especially A73-88 for this piece). However, this seal impression indicates that the scarabs at the Scarab Factory were not exclusively produced for export, but could have to some extent a local use. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I., 1884–5 (third memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Gorton, A.F. 1996, Egyptian and Egyptianizing scarabs: a typology of steatite, faience, and paste scarabs from Punic and other Mediterranean sites, Oxford.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XX, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (PB.03)
